title: Derivative Calculator – Numerical Derivative of Functions at a Point and on an Interval

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: \[ f'(x_0) = \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{f(x_0 + h) - f(x_0)}{h}, \] whenever this limit exists. If the limit exists for every point in an interval, we obtain a new function \(f'(x)\), the derivative of \(f\).

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: \[ f'(x_0) \approx \frac{f(x_0 + h) - f(x_0 - h)}{2h}. \] This uses information on both sides of \(x_0\) and has a truncation error proportional to \(h^2\) for smooth functions. Our calculator also compares this approximation with the same formula at step size \(h/2\) to estimate numerical error.
